statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: La Salle 66, American 53
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP)-- Steven Smith scored 22 of his 28 in the second half and LaSalle broke a five-game losing streak with a 66-53 win over American Tuesday night. The Explorers (2-7), trailed by 12 after American (5-4) opened the second half on a 16-2 run. However, the Eagles hit just one shot from the field over the final 7:54. Smith shouldered the comeback with 18 points over the final 12:43, including 11 straight at one point for the Explorers. He was 8-for-19 from the floor and more than made up for the opening 6:53 of the second half, when La Salle didn't hit a field goal. Smith also grabbed 11 rebounds. His third 3-pointer put La Salle ahead for good 52-50 with 4:38 to play. Andre Ingram scored 16 points to lead the Eagles, who had won eight straight at home. He hit three 3-pointers during the early second half run that gave American a 41-29 lead. Patrick Okpwae scored American's first 10 points, on his way to 14 in the first half. The Eagles shot 34 percent from the field and went just 7-for-28 from 3-point range for the game. Darnell Harris added 16 points for La Salle, which made 20 of 27 free throws. ^
